You could also use JUnitPerf (?), I believe.

    > -----Original Message-----
    > From: Jeff Taylor [mailto:jeff@...]
    > Sent: Thursday, September 13, 2001 6:53 PM
    > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
    > Subject: [junit] Multi-threaded testing w/ Junit?
    > 
    > 
    > I have a working junit testcase class that I want to turn 
    > into more of a
    > stress test. The goal is to spawn multiple threads - each 
    > one running
    > the test case a fixed number of times (i.e. 100) . This 
    > way, we can
    > simulate multiple clients.
    > 
    > I'm trying to determine the best approach. To implement a 
    > class as a
    > thread - you need to have your class extend Thread. The 
    > testcase class,
    > of course already extends TestCase.
    > 
    > Does anyone have any ideas? Thanks in advance
    > 
    > -Jeff
